data.title: MIT researchers “speak objects into existence” using AI and robotics
data.description: MIT researchers at the School of Architecture and Planning developed a speech-to-reality system that combines generative AI, natural language processing, and robotic assembly to fabricate physical objects from spoken prompts.
data.site_name: MIT News | Massachusetts Institute of Technology
data.keywords: MIT Morningside Academy for Design, MIT Center for Bits and Atoms, computational design, 3D generative AI, robotic assembly, natural language understanding, Speech-to-Reality system, Star Trek replicator, voxelization, Alexander Htet Kyaw, Neil Gershenfeld, Se Hwan Jeon, Miana Smith
